events.message: Customer reported a car accident involving front-end damage after colliding with a guardrail during heavy rain.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident based on the keywords 'car' and 'collision' provided in the initial report.
Agent Jennifer Smith was assigned to the case to ensure proper handling of the vehicle collision claim.
The claimant was contacted to confirm receipt of the accident claim and provided information about next steps.
Requested police report, photographs of the car damage, and insurance policy documents for further review.
Customer submitted all requested documents including a detailed police report and multiple photos of the vehicle collision.
The investigation team began assessing the extent of the damage to the vehicle and liability based on submitted evidence.
Investigation concluded, confirming the accident was non-fault and damages were consistent with the reported collision.
A settlement offer was proposed covering repair costs and rental car reimbursement during the repair period.
Customer expressed satisfaction with the clear communication and timely settlement proposal after their auto accident.
The claim was formally approved following acceptance of the settlement offer by the claimant.
Payment was issued promptly to cover all repair expenses and related costs after claim approval.
The auto accident claim was officially closed after successful payment and resolution confirmation from the customer.
